summary: This document contains correspondence regarding the liquidation of various entity accounts owned by Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses the closure of accounts and the transfer of funds into the estate account, as well as the dissolution of several companies associated with Epstein. The document highlights the roles of various individuals involved in the estate management.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is referenced as the decedent whose estate is being managed and whose accounts are being liquidated.

persons.name: Michelle Smith-Roberts
persons.context: Michelle Smith-Roberts is involved in the liquidation process of Epstein's estate accounts and communicates with other parties regarding the necessary actions.

persons.name: K. Indyke
persons.context: K. Indyke is one of the co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, requesting the closure of accounts and transfer of funds.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Richard D. Kahn is also a co-executor of Epstein's estate, working alongside K. Indyke in managing the estate's assets.

persons.name: Erika Kellerhals
persons.context: Erika Kellerhals is a member of the law firm handling the estate's legal matters and communicates with bank representatives regarding account liquidation.

persons.name: Kurt Petri
persons.context: Kurt Petri is involved in the legal review of the accounts associated with Epstein's estate and communicates with other parties regarding the liquidation process.

persons.name: Dina Perry
persons.context: Dina Perry is included in the correspondence regarding the liquidation of Epstein's estate accounts.

connections.description: K. Indyke is a co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, managing the liquidation of his assets.
Richard D. Kahn is a co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, involved in the management of the estate's assets.
Michelle Smith-Roberts and Erika Kellerhals communicate regarding the liquidation of Epstein's estate accounts.
K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn are co-executors working together on the estate of Jeffrey Epstein.
Kurt Petri and Dina Perry are both involved in the legal aspects of the estate's liquidation.

events.title: Liquidation of Estate Accounts
events.description: The estate of Jeffrey Epstein is liquidating various entity accounts and transferring funds into the estate account.

keyFacts: The estate of Jeffrey Epstein is in the process of liquidating several entity accounts.
Michelle Smith-Roberts is coordinating with various parties regarding the liquidation process.
K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn are co-executors of Epstein's estate.
The document includes requests for the closure of accounts associated with Epstein's businesses.
Several companies linked to Epstein are being dissolved as of December 31, 2019.
